30 #include "bb_sensors/ADS122C04_ADC_PI.hpp" // initParams
31 #include "bb_sensors/POL_OP.hpp" // POL_OP class wrapper
32 #include "bb_sensors/argparse.h" // ArgumentParser
33 
34 #include "ros/ros.h"
35 #include "std_msgs/Int32MultiArray.h"

37 #define LOG(x) std::cout << x << std::endl
38 
39 #define MUX_ADDR 0x70
40 #define A2D_ADDR_1 0x40
41 #define A2D_ADDR_2 0x41
43 argparse::ArgumentParser parser("Parser");
44 
52 bool initParser(argparse::ArgumentParser &parser, int argc, char **argv){
53  parser.add_argument()
54  .names({"--gain"})
55  .description("Set the PGA gain for the ADCs (3-bit config, see datasheet for"
56  " ADS122C04). Valid values 0-7, gain will be 2^g where g is the"
57  " argument provided here.")
58  .required(false);
59 
60  parser.add_argument()
61  .names({"--rate"})
62  .description("Set the conversion rate for the ADCs. Valid values 0-6."
63  " 0 = 20SPS, each increment approximately doubles the"
64  " data rate up to 6 = 1000SPS.")
65  .required(false);
66 
67  parser.add_argument()
68  .names({"-n","--number_of_units"})
69  .description("The number of POL-OP units connected to the mux (1 - 8).")
70  .required(false);
71 
72  parser.enable_help();
73 
74  auto err = parser.parse(argc, const_cast<const char**>(argv));
75  if (err) {
76  std::stringstream ss;
77  ss<<err;
78  ROS_ERROR("argparse error: %s", ss.str().c_str());
79  return false;
80  }
81 
82  return true;
83 }
84 
92 int init_mux(std::string bus){
93  int fd;
94 
95  if ((fd = open(bus.c_str(), O_RDWR)) < 0) std::exit(1);
96 
97  if (ioctl(fd, I2C_SLAVE, MUX_ADDR) < 0){
98  close(fd);
99  std::exit(1);
100  }
101 
102  return fd;
103 }
104 
116 bool select_channel(const uint8_t channel, const int fd){
117  int ret = i2c_smbus_write_byte_data(fd, 0x00, (1 << channel));
118  if (ret == -1) {LOG("Failed to select channel");}
119  // Allow time for channel switch
120  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(10));
121 }
122 
126 int main(int argc, char **argv){
127  /* Initialise argparser and set specified parameters. */
128  if(!initParser(parser, argc, argv)) return -1;
129  if(parser.exists("help")){
130  parser.print_help();
131  return 0;
132  }
133 
134  int pga_gain =
135  parser.exists("gain") ?
136  parser.get<int>("gain") :
137  0;
138 
139  int data_rate =
140  parser.exists("rate") ?
141  parser.get<int>("rate") :
142  0;
143 
144  int n_pol_ops =
145  parser.exists("number_of_units") ?
146  parser.get<int>("number_of_units") :
147  1;
148 
149  ROS_INFO("Gain setting: %d", pga_gain);
150  ROS_INFO("Number of POL-OPs: %d", n_pol_ops);
151 
152  /* Initialise the ROS node */
153  ros::init(argc, argv, "i2c_mux_pol_op");
154  ros::NodeHandle n;
155 
156  /* Initialise the mux */
157  std::string bus = "/dev/i2c-1";
158  int fd = init_mux(bus);
159 
160  /*
161  Because the number of unit is configurable, we generate two parallel
162  vectors of Publishers and POL_OP objects (i.e. pubs[i] is the Publisher
163  for data read from pol_ops[i]). These vectors are grown to the correct
164  size.
165  */
166  std::vector<ros::Publisher> pubs;
167  std::vector<POL_OP> pol_ops;
168 
169  /* Initialise each unit and its Publisher */
170  for (int i = 0; i < n_pol_ops; i++){
171  select_channel(i, fd);
172  POL_OP poi(bus, A2D_ADDR_1, A2D_ADDR_2, false, i);
173  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(500));
174  std::stringstream name;
175  name << "pol_op_" << i;
176  ros::Publisher poi_pub =
177  n.advertise<std_msgs::Int32MultiArray>(name.str().c_str(), 1000);
178  pubs.push_back(poi_pub);
179  pol_ops.push_back(poi);
180  }
181 
182 
183  /* Set custom options for each pol_op unit */
184  for (int i = 0; i < n_pol_ops; i++){
185  pol_ops[i].set_gain(pga_gain);
186  pol_ops[i].set_data_rate(data_rate);
187  }
188 
189 
190  /*
191  Read from each unit in sequence.
192  Note that the timing code and related output was used to characterise
193  sensor latency and does not have any function.
194  */
195  ros::Rate loop_rate(10);
196  auto start = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
197  while(ros::ok()) {
198  int s_readings = 4;
199  int readings[s_readings];
200  auto full_read_start = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
201  for (int i = 0; i < n_pol_ops; i++){
202 
203  for (int j = 0; j < s_readings; j++) readings[j] = 0; // Clear readings
204  // Read from pol_op
205  select_channel(i, fd);
206  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(1));
207 
208  // Min working delay = 25; 11ms was used for pol experiments
209  // before this was known.
210  bool success = pol_ops[i].read_sensor_interleaved(readings, 25);
211 
212  std::vector<int> res(readings, readings+s_readings);
213 
214  // Publish photodiode data on the correct topic.
215  std_msgs::Int32MultiArray msg;
216  msg.data = res;
217  auto time = std::chrono::system_clock::now() - start;
218  auto millis = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(time);
219  std::cout << "Time since last publication: " << millis.count() << "ms" << std::endl;
220  pubs[i].publish(msg);
221  start = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
222  //ROS_INFO("Unit %d: {%d, %d, %d, %d}", i, res[0], res[1], res[2], res[3]);
223  }
224 
225 
226  auto full_read_time = std::chrono::system_clock::now() - full_read_start;
227  auto full_read_millis = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(full_read_time);
228  std::cout << "Full read time: " << full_read_millis.count() << "ms" << std::endl;
229 
230  ros::spinOnce();
231  loop_rate.sleep();
232  }
233  LOG("Exiting.");
234  return 0;
235 }
